candidates.title: Halo gadgets updates
candidates.body: Includes prod and 512MiB K values, extended testing and test logging. some fmt and clippy updates, etc

candidates.title: chore: lock versions to the correct minor, and update
candidates.body:
1. Update minimum versions for in-workspace crates.
2. Use the tilde constraint to ensure that we don't update to the next minor version.

Otherwise, the next minor release (which will re-release the changes on master) will break anything depending on this release.

NOTE: we should also go ahead and _release_ those minor releases. This is kind of hard to test otherwise.

candidates.title: feat: extend proofs API such that aggregation can use snarkpack versions
candidates.body:
feat: extend aggregation tests to ensure version incompatibility
feat: update dependencies

candidates.title: chore: remove unused dependencies from storage-proofs-update
candidates.body:
`storage-proofs-update` includes a lot of dependencies it isn't actually
using, this commit removes those.

candidates.title: tests: use non-failing fil_logger
candidates.body:
There are tests that initialized some logger. When initializing `fil_logger`,
it would panic. Use instead `fil_logger::maybe_init()` which doesn't fail in
case there is already a logger running.

candidates.title: Replaces #1578
candidates.body: This PR is on an editable branch and replaces #1578 (cc @Stebalien)

candidates.title: build: use byte-unit version which supports Rust 2018
candidates.body:
The current version of `byte-unit` uses Rust 2021 edition, which breaks our build.

Closes #1573

candidates.title: Some test updates
candidates.body: I'm ok renaming the `big-tests` feature flag if there's a better suggestion.

candidates.title: fix: update heim dep to (current) master branch
feat: update bellperson to v0.18.0
candidates.body: This PR updates bellperson, neptune (for using the latest bellperson as well) and the rust-toolchain version.

candidates.title: Add support for Empty Sector Update proofs (for SnapDeals)
feat: update all dependencies for our v10.0.0 release
expose 'multicore-sdr' feature
candidates.body: You can't use the multicore-sdr feature through filecoin-proofs in current implemention.

candidates.title: fix: upgrade to latest versions
candidates.body:
The latest versions of the gpu dependencies contain support for CUDA. Therefore
the `gpu` feature is split into `cuda` and `opencl`. By default only `opencl` is
enabled.

BREAKING CHANGE: The `gpu` feature is replaced by the `opencl` feature.

candidates.title: feat: use upstream group, ff and pairing dependencies
candidates.body:
- [x] `filecoin-hashers`
- [x] `fr32`
- [x] `storage-proofs-core`
- [x] `storage-proofs-porep`
- [x] `storage-proofs-post`
- [x] `filecoin-proofs`
- [x] everything else

Note that this PR removes the `pairing` and `blst` features and drops support for `paired`'s BLS12-381 implementation.

chosen_pr.title: Halo gadgets updates
chosen_pr.body: Includes prod and 512MiB K values, extended testing and test logging. some fmt and clippy updates, etc
